page.title: 16 A DAY IN SUMMER
page.content: At 7.30am I got up, prepared breakfast for Helen,Richard and myself_ John had been up since 6am cutting a field of grass.After breakfast I got Helen and Richard dressed,washed up and then went to feed the hens and let them out.I then went to Masham to collect some cattle feed.After coffee with John I prepared lunch.Lunch over we all went to the field to help bag the bales of silage.At 5pm I came home to pack us a picnic tea up.I took it back to the field, then we carried on with the silage until 6.45pm.By then Richard was getting tired so we came home. I bathed Helen and Richard, got them their supper and put them to bed about 8.00pm.After washing up I decided to do some baking and I finished that at 9.30pm.By 10.30 I had had a bath, we'd eaten supper and were ready for bed. {Kathleen Stockil }
